JOJO

About

Joanna "JoJo" Levesque is and American R&B and Pop singer, songwriter, and actress. Born on December 20, 1990 and raised in Foxborough, Massachusetts. JoJo started singing when she was about two years-old imitating nursery rhymes, R&B, jazz, and soul genres. Her mother and father were singers as well, but divorced when JoJo was four years-old. JoJo performed all the time in singing competitions, and local talent shows when she was very young. At seven years-old, she appeared on the shows Kids Say the Darndest Things: On the Road in Boston and Destination Stardom. In 2003, she was 12 when she signed with Blackground Records and Da Family and debuted her hit single, "Leave (Get Out)" which was released in 2004. It became number one on the Mainstream Top 40 chart, she was 13 when this happened and she was the youngest solo artist to have a number one single in the United States. She is also known for her songs, "Baby It's You" and "Not That Kind of Girl" from her first self titled album, JoJo.

In 2006, JoJo started acting and appeared in the movie, Aquamarine, as Hailey. She also starred in RV, a comedy family movie with Robin Williams. In October 2006, JoJo's second album, The High Road, was released. Her single, "Too Little Too Late" became very popular as it was number three on the Billboard Hot 100. JoJo wanted to write her own songs for her third album and so it was in the works. Unfortunately, her songs were leaked through a YouTube channel. In 2009, JoJo was having trouble with her record label Da Family Entertainment for putting her in musical limbo and sought $500,000 for her troubles and was released from her contract. Blackground Records made a deal to have JoJo's thrid album distributed by Interscope Records. She then traveled to Toronto to act in a movie called, True Confessions of a Hollywood Starlet as Morgan Carter, where it was broadcast on Lifetime Television in August 2008.

In 2010, JoJo released her first mixtape and put out her single, "In the Dark". In 2011, she continued acting and appeared on the TV show, Hawaii Five-0 as Courtney Russell. Her third album was still in the works and it was going to be called "All I want is Everything" but later changed it to "Jumping Trains", she wanted her music to be different and fresh. Her lead single, "The Other Chick" was supposed to be released digitally but the label made it a buzz single which was meant as a potential promotional song. JoJo remixed a song by rapper, Drake, called "Marvin's Room". She renamed it as "Marvin's Room (Can't Do Better)" and she wrote it as a female's perspective to express frustration towards an ex-lover and his supposed new girlfriend. Drake expressed his appreciation for her interpretation of his song.

In July 2013, JoJo was still having issues with her record labels Blackground Records and Da Family. She had filed a lawsuit against them for "irreparable damages to her professional career". The case was dropped in December 2013 as JoJo and Blackground's attourneys came to an agreement outside the court. In January 2014, she was released from her multi-year battle with Blackground Records and signed a new recording contract with Atlantic Records. She released an extended play, "#LoveJo", on February 14, 2014, that covers three classic songs "Caught Up in the Rapture of Love", "Take Me Home", and "Glory". JoJo's new website under Atlantic Records was relaunched in 2015 of August. In the same month, she released a "tringle" titled "III" as a preview to her third studio album. She went on a world tour in November 2015 for the I Am JoJo tour. In December 2015 she release the sequel to "#LoveJo", called "#LoveJo2". In July 2016, she released the lead single, "F*** Apologies", featuring rapper, Wiz Khalifa. Her third studio album, "Mad Love" was released in October 2016. Followed by going on her Mad Love tour in 2017. JoJo announced that she re-recorded her last two albums and singles, "Demonstrate" and "Disaster" in December 2018 and reworked the production.

JoJo departed from Atlantic Records to a new music venture, Clover Music. Clover Music is JoJo's own music imprint label in a joint deal with Interscope Records. In 2019, Clover Music is no longer affiliated with Interscope. Warner Records bought Interscope Records and Clover Music will now associate with Warner Records. JoJo collaborated with R&B singer-songwriter, PJ Morton. Together they sang his hit song, "Say So" and it won a Grammy in 2020. In 2019, JoJo released a single called, "Joanna" followed by a music video. She then collaborated with label mate, Chika, on her new single, "Sabotage", later she released a new single, "Man", to promote her next album. On May 1, 2020, her fourth album, "Good To Know" was released. In August 2020, JoJo released a new single, "What U Need" on social media platform, Instagram. Her deluxe version of the "Good To Know" album was released August 28. In October 2020, she sang a song written by Diane Warren called, "The Change", to serve as the official anthem for the Joe Biden 2020 Presidential campaign. Then JoJo released her first holiday album, "December Baby". Due to the pandemic, JoJo delayed and cancelled her "Good To Know" tour. In 2021, JoJo competed in the TV show, The Masked Singer as Black Swan. She finished in second place making her the first female runner-up on the show. In October 2021, JoJo released a capsule project for an EP called "Trying Not To Think About It". In 2022, she plans on going on tour to promote her EP.

JoJo on Wikipedia
